meanings.definition: A material or substance used to cover the exterior of a building.
meanings.sent1: The metal cladding on the building protects it from rain and wind.
meanings.sent2: The cladding on the house gives it a modern and sleek appearance.
meanings.sent3: The cladding on the skyscraper decided to take a day off, leaving the building exposed to the elements.
meanings.sent4: The ivy climbed the walls of the house, acting as a natural cladding.
meanings.sent5: The colorful cladding on the playground made it stand out in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The act of covering a surface with a protective layer.
meanings.sent1: The cladding of paint on the fence prevented it from rotting.
meanings.sent2: Proper cladding of the roof with tiles ensured it was waterproof.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat attempted cladding itself with leaves to hide from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The knight's armor served as a cladding, shielding him from enemy attacks.
meanings.sent5: The thick cladding of snow on the mountain made it a perfect spot for skiing.
